summary: A galaxy is a group of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter held together by gravity. The Milky Way, where our solar system is located, is an example of a galaxy. There are many types of galaxies, such as elliptical, spiral, and irregular shapes. The universe contains billions of galaxies, each with millions to trillions of stars. Galaxies are often found in clusters and superclusters, and the space between them is mostly empty. The Milky Way is part of the Local Group of galaxies and is located within the Virgo Supercluster.
title: Galaxy
